TravelTriangle > Blog > Visakhapatnam > 8 Hill Stations Near Vishakhapatnam: Admire The Scenic Charm And Serenity 8 Hill Stations Near Vishakhapatnam: Admire The Scenic Charm And Serenity .. SHARES Updated Date: 20 April 2023 Visakhapatnam is a fabulous and scenic coastal town. Commercially popular as a port town, Visakhapatnam is adorned with some beautiful places all around for quick rejuvenating escapes. Like many stunning beaches, there are quite a few mesmerising hill stations near Visakhapatnam that offer endless scenic charm and tranquillity. For a peaceful and relaxing hideout, check out these most beautiful hill stations near Visakhapatnam and plan a weekend vacay from this serene town!. Table Of Content 8 Scenic Hill Stations Near Visakhapatnam The following are the most visited hill stations near Visakhapatnam that are known for offering the most memorable holiday  amidst nature. Ananthagiri – 82 km Lambasingi – 101 km Araku – 114 km Nallamala Hills – 528 km Tirumala – 728 km Nagari Hills – 757 km Seshachalam Hills – 791 km Horsley Hills – 854 km 1. Ananthagiri A perfect hideout for relaxation and invigoration, Ananthagiri is one of the best options for hill stations near Visakhapatnam. Enjoy panoramic views all around and trek to hillocks and waterfalls and spend a couple of days relaxing your mind and body. Distance from Vishakhaptnam: 82 kmKey attractions: Galikonda View Point, Tatiguda Waterfall, and Katika WaterfallPlaces to stay: Haritha Resort, Hill and Valley Adventure Resort and Prince Deluxe LodgeIdeal Duration: 1 Nights/2 Days Must Read: 25 Best Places To Visit In Visakhapatnam To Relish The True Charm Of This Coastal Gem! Lambasingi Located at an elevation of 1025 meters, Lambasingi is a quaint hamlet in Andhra Pradesh and one of the must-see hill stations near Visakhapatnam. Surrounded by hills and dense forests, this is a fabulous hideaway for rejuvenation and owing to its chilly weather and cold breeze, November to January is the best month to visit this holiday destination. Distance from Vishakhaptnam: 101 kmKey attractions: Yerravaram waterfalls and JInasaa Sunrise viewpointPlaces to stay: THE SBS Inn, Lodge Voda Residency and Hari Priya Garden ResortThings To Do: Sightseeing, Trekking, CampingIdeal Duration: 1 Nights/2 Days Suggested Read: 8 Charming Places To Visit In Vizag In Summer For Your Trip To Andhra Pradesh 3. Araku A green valley and hills sum up the scenery at Araku valley. This is a must-see hill station near Visakhapatnam known for its picturesque landscape and serenity. Located at a distance of little more than 100 km, one can drive down from Visakhapatnam but the best and most exciting way to reach Araku is in a meter gauge train. The train ride through dense forests and more than 50 caves are extremely exciting and should not be missed on.Distance from Vishakhaptnam: 114 kmKey attractions: Bora Caves, Tribal Museum, Coffee Museum, and Padmapuram GardenPlaces to stay: Mountain View Resort, Mayuri APTDC Resort, and Krishna Tara ComfortThings To Do: Hiking, Camping & Bird Watching, Excavation Of The PastIdeal Duration: 1 Day Suggested Read: Araku Valley Guide: 6 Must Experiences To Go Off The Beaten Path In Andhra Pradesh 4. Nallamala Hills Encircling the dam built on Krishna river, Nallamal Hills is another choice amongst the hill stations near Visakhapatnam. The rocky terrain, lake and age-old temples enhance the charm of the place and allure tourists round the year.Distance from Vishakhaptnam: 528 kmKey attractions: Srisailam Dam on River Krishna, Cumbum Lake, Lord Shiva Temples of Mahanandi,Ahobilam and Mallikarjuna Temple and Mallela Theertham waterfall.Places to stay: Maurya Inn, Hotel S V Regency, and Hotel Jayshree Suggested Read: 10 Breathtakingly Beautiful Mahabalipuram Temples That Are The Soul Of South India! 5. Tirumala Located in the Chittor district of Andhra Pradesh, Tirumala hills is known for its calm and spiritual ambiance. Known for world famous Balaji temple, Tirumala is visited by devotees round the year but the lush green hills and hilly trails cannot be overlooked. If you are looking for a peaceful getaway from Visakhapatnam, consider Tirumala hills for complete solace and relaxation. Distance from Vishakhaptnam: 728 kmKey attractions: Sri Venkateswara Swami Temple, Sri Venkateswara Museum and Shrivari Padalu.Places to stay: Bhimas Deluxe Hotel, Hotel Maurya and Hotel Raj ParkIdeal Duration: 1 Nights/2 Days Suggested Read: 10 Amazing Things To Do In Pachmarhi For A Fun-Filled Getaway In The Heart Of India Planning your holiday but confused about where to go? And beauty all along Read More See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE.COM Visit Website 6. Nagari Hills Perched on the banks of Kusasthali River, Nagari Hills is endowed with awe-inspiring beauty. With the least commercialisation and touristy things; Nagari Hills is a heaven for photographers, trekkers and nature enthusiasts. Located quite a few km away from Visakhapatnam, Nagari Hills is one of the most beautiful hill stations close to the port town. Distance from Vishakhaptnam: 757 kmKey attractions: Nagari Nose and Kailasakona WaterfallsPlaces to stay: Pride Inn Resort Suggested Read: 15 Places To Visit Near Madurai: The Gateway To Enjoying South India’s Beauty 7. Frequently Asked Questions On Hill Stations Near Visakhapatnam Is there any direct train between Tirumala and Visakhapatnam? There is a direct train between Tirunmala and Visakhapatnam which takes about 15 hours to reach the destination. What to do in Araku? One can enjoy caving in Bora caves and see the stunning limestone rock formation, visit the coffee and tribal museum and indulge in forest hiking. Which is the nearest railhead to Nagari Hills? Nagari Hill has its own railhead. Which is the coolest place in Andhra Pradesh? Lambasingi is the coolest place in Andhra Pradesh. What to do in Lambasingi? Camping and trekking are the major activities enjoyed in Lambasingi. Does it snow in Lambasingi? Perched at an elevation of 1000 m, Lambasingi is one of the coldest places in Andhra Pradesh and south India. This misty and foggy hill station in Andhra Pradesh often experiences snowfall in the form of flakes when during winter the temperature reaches the freezing point. How to reach Horsley Hills? Madnapalley is the nearest railhead, 26 km away from Horsley Hills. Located on the Delhi – Chittoor railroad line, this station is connected with major Indian cities.
